mods.abstract: Ninety Dollars Reward. Will be paid for the apprehension and delivery in any Jail in the State of the following described convictsm who escaped from the Louisiana Penitentiary on the 3rd inst.: FRANK, a slave belonging to Mrs. Vannard sentenced by the Criminal Court of N.O., in the 5th of Dec., 1845, to ten years imprisonment at hard labor for Arson. He is a light Mulattoe, about 30 years of age, 5 feet 1 inch high, has no visible marks, is a Creole of Louisiana. ROBERT ROBINSON, a free man of color, sentenced by the First District Court, on the 22d May, 1852 to Ten years imprisonment at hard labor for stabbing with intent to Murder. He is about 22 years of age, 5 feet 7 1-2 inches high, Black, has a large scar or wart on the nose, reads and writes, and will no doubt have false free papers, is a Creole of Louisiana. CHARLES ANDRIEUX a native of France, about 32 years of age, of dark complexion, with dark hair and dark eyes. 5 feet 4 1|2 inches high , and weighs about 145 pounds. He was sentenced by the First District Court, on the 7th of January 1851, to four years imprisonment at hard labor for the crime of Larceny. Thirty dollars will be paid for the apprehension of either of the above described convicts and all reasonable expenses for their delivery. McHATTON, WARD & Co. Baton Rouge June 4tf Lessees
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
